data.Sentence_cn: 课文35  太空探索
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 35 Space odyssey

data.Sentence_cn: 我们什么时候才能认真考虑殖民火星?
data.Sentence: When will it be possible for us to think seriously about colonising Mars?

data.Sentence_cn: 月球很可能成为太阳系的工业中心。从月球上的岩石中可以获得航天飞船的燃料，
data.Sentence: The Moon is likely to become the industrial hub of the Solar System supplying the rocket fuels for its ships,

data.Sentence_cn: 很容易从中提炼出液态氧。
data.Sentence: easily obtainable from the lunar rocks in the form of liquid oxygen.

data.Sentence_cn: 其原因在于月球的重力。
data.Sentence: The reason lies in its gravity.

data.Sentence_cn: 因为月球的重只有地球的1/8，
data.Sentence: Because the Moon has only an eightieth of the Earth's mass,

data.Sentence_cn: 它需要耗的能量少97%，
data.Sentence: it requires 97% less energy

data.Sentence_cn: 对比从月球到地球的25万英里所消耗的能量要以及地球表面进入地球轨道的200英里。
data.Sentence: to travel the quarter of a million miles from the Moon to Earth-orbit than the 200 mile-journey from Earth's surface into orbit!

data.Sentence_cn: 这点听起来令人难以置信，但却很容易计算出来。
data.Sentence: This may sound fantastic, but it is easily calculated.

data.Sentence_cn: 要乘坐一枚火箭飞离地球，火箭的速度要达到每秒7英里，
data.Sentence: To escape from the Earth in a rocket, one must travel at seven miles per second.

data.Sentence_cn: 而从月球出发的相应速度史是每秒1.5英里。
data.Sentence: The comparable speed from the Moon is only 1.5 miles per second.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于月球表面的重力仅是地球表面的1/6 -- 还记得阿波罗飞船中的宇航员累松地跳跃 --
data.Sentence: Because the gravity on the Moon's surface is only a sixth of Earth's (remember how easily the Apollo astronauts bounded along),

data.Sentence_cn: 在月球上加速到每秒1.5英里比在地球上所用能源要少得多。
data.Sentence: it takes much less energy to accelerate to that 1.5mps than it does on Earth.

data.Sentence_cn: 月球居民在太空遨游的费用仅是地球上朋友飞越同样路所需费用的3%。
data.Sentence: Moon dwellers will be able to fly in space at only three percent of the cost of similar journeys by their terrestrial cousins.

data.Sentence_cn: 亚瑟.C.克拉克曾提议，一种创新的想法要经过以下3个阶段：
data.Sentence: Arthur C.Clark once suggested a revolutionary idea passes through three phases:

data.Sentence_cn: 1 “根本不可能，不要浪费我的时间。”
data.Sentence: 1.  'It's impossible -- don't waste my time.'

data.Sentence_cn: 2 “可能，但不值得做。”
data.Sentence: 2.  'It's possible, but not worth doing.'

data.Sentence_cn: 3 “我一直说这是个好想法。”
data.Sentence: 3.  'I said it was a good idea all along.'

data.Sentence_cn: 征服火星的计划 -- 一个比月球远160倍的星球 -- 就可以明确地从第2阶段进入第3阶段，
data.Sentence: The idea of colonising Mars -- a world 160 times more distant than the Moon -- will move decisively from the second phase to the third,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果有相当数量的人永久性地住在太空。
data.Sentence: when a significant number of people are living permanently in space.

data.Sentence_cn: 火星对未来的星际旅客说有着特殊的魅力。
data.Sentence: Mars has an extraordinary fascination for would-be voyagers.

data.Sentence_cn: 美国、俄罗斯和欧洲都有许多热心此项事业的人 -- 其中的不少是认真和资深的科学家，他们一直梦想着把人送上火星。
data.Sentence: America, Russia and Europe are filled with enthusiasts -- many of them serious and senior scientists who dream of sending people to it.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们的目标是可以理解的。
data.Sentence: Their aim is understandable.

data.Sentence_cn: 火星是太阳系里与地球最接近的一颗行星。
data.Sentence: It is the one world in the Solar System that is most like the Earth.

data.Sentence_cn: 这是一个红色沙漠的世界（因而得名：红色行星），
data.Sentence: It is a world of red sandy deserts (hence its name -- the Red Planet),

data.Sentence_cn: 无云的天空，凶猛的沙暴，比大峡谷还宽的裂缝，起码有一座山有珠穆朗玛峰的近两倍高。
data.Sentence: cloudless skies, savage sandstorms, chasms wider than the Grand Canyon and at least one mountain more than twice as tall as Everest.

data.Sentence_cn: 看起来，它很合适居住。
data.Sentence: It seems ideal for settlement.
